intro: Wikstroemia isae, commonly known as the Hawaiian sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Thymelaeaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant thrives in coastal environments and is often found growing in sandy or rocky soils. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
